New Records: Paul Skenes has already blown past the franchise’s rookie strikeout record, now sitting at 167.
Skenes is the first pitcher in the Modern Era with 150 strikeouts and an ERA under 2.00 in his first 22 career games.
Key Match Events: Paul Skenes dominated the Reds with a nine-strikeout performance, helping the Pirates beat the Reds at Great American Ball Park, 2-0.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Derek Shelton has not been afraid to use his voice to endorse players he felt are award-worthy, and he made his case as to why Paul Skenes should be the National League Rookie of the Year.
Post-Match Reflections: Skenes will surely start one more time in New York, so his Rookie of the Year resume isn’t complete yet.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Skenes' changeup was a difference maker for him today, with six of his nine strikeouts coming as a result of his offspeed pitch.
Others: The hype around Skenes was immense coming into the season, as he was touted as the top pitching prospect of his generation.
Skenes' focus is more on continuing to make starts like he had Sunday.
